meanings.definition: To cause distress or suffering to
meanings.sent1: Seeing her cry was aggrieving to me.
meanings.sent2: The loss of his pet aggrieved him deeply.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to play was aggrieving but also amusing.
meanings.sent4: The relentless rain aggrieved the farmers' crops.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the song aggrieved my heart.

meanings.definition: To provoke resentment or anger in
meanings.sent1: His rude comments aggrieved his friends.
meanings.sent2: The unfair treatment aggrieved the employees.
meanings.sent3: Her constant lateness aggrieved her boss, but also made him chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The broken promise aggrieved her like a sharp thorn.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal aggrieved him to the core of his being.

meanings.sent1: The aggrieving news of the accident left everyone in tears.
meanings.sent2: The aggrieving sight of the abandoned puppy touched her heart.
meanings.sent3: The aggrieving movie made her cry, but also laugh at its absurdity.
meanings.sent4: The aggrieving memories haunted her like ghostly whispers.
meanings.sent5: The aggrieving melody of the sad song lingered in the air.
